bootupJs.name: JavaScript Boot-up Time
bootupJs.description: The amount of CPU time each script consumes per page.  This metric comes from [Lighthouse](https://developers.google.com/web/updates/2018/05/lighthouse#javascript_boot-up_time_is_high) and is only available in mobile tests.

bytesCss.name: CSS Bytes
bytesCss.description: The sum of transfer size kilobytes of all external stylesheets requested by the page. An external stylesheets is identified as a resource with the `css` file extension or a MIME type containing `css`.

bytesFont.name: Font Bytes
bytesFont.description: The sum of transfer size kilobytes of all fonts requested by the page. A font is identified as a resource with the `eot`, `ttf`, `woff`, `woff2`, or `otf` file extensions or a MIME type containing `font`.

bytesHtml.name: HTML Bytes
bytesHtml.description: The sum of transfer size kilobytes of all HTML documents requested by the page. An HTML document is identified as a resource with the `html` or `html` file extensions or a MIME type containing `html`.

bytesImg.name: Image Bytes
bytesImg.description: The sum of transfer size kilobytes of all external images requested by the page. An external image is identified as a resource with the `png`, `gif`, `jpg`, `jpeg`, `webp`, `ico`, or `svg` file extensions or a MIME type containing `image`.

bytesJs.name: JavaScript Bytes
bytesJs.description: The sum of transfer size kilobytes of all external scripts requested by the page. An external script is identified as a resource with the `js` or `json` file extensions or a MIME type containing `script` or `json`.

bytesOther.name: Other Bytes
bytesOther.description: The sum of transfer size kilobytes of all unidentified resources requested by the page. An unidentified resource is one that does not match a known script, font, image, stylesheet, XML file, video, HTML document, or plaintext file.

bytesTotal.name: Total Kilobytes
bytesTotal.description: The sum of [transfer size](https://www.w3.org/TR/resource-timing-2/#dom-performanceresourcetiming-transfersize) kilobytes of all resources requested by the page.

bytesVideo.name: Video Bytes
bytesVideo.description: The sum of transfer size kilobytes of all videos requested by the page. A video is identified as a resource with the `mp4`, `swf`, `f4v`, or `flv` file extensions or a MIME type containing `flash`.

canonical.name: rel=canonical
canonical.description: The percent of pages with a valid canonical link. Canonical pages are detected by [Lighthouse](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/canonical). This metric is only available in mobile tests.

compileJs.name: JS Compile Time
compileJs.description: The number of milliseconds spent compiling each JavaScript resource.

dcl.name: DOMContentLoaded
dcl.description: The number of seconds from the time the navigation started until the initial HTML document has been completely loaded and parsed. See the [DOMContentLoaded event on MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Events/DOMContentLoaded) for more info.

evalJs.name: JS Evaluation Time
evalJs.description: The number of milliseconds spent evaluating each JavaScript resource.

fcp.name: First Contentful Paint
fcp.description: The number of seconds from the time the navigation started until the page's primary content appears on the screen.

hreflang.name: hreflang
hreflang.description: The percent of pages with a valid `hreflang` attribute, which allows crawlers to discover alternate translations of the page content. Validity is measured by Lighthouse. This metric is only available in mobile tests.

fontDisplay.name: Font Display
fontDisplay.description: The percent of pages that avoid the flash of invisible text (FOIT) during web font loading by using the `font-display` CSS property. This metric is measured by [Lighthouse](https://developers.google.com/web/updates/2018/05/lighthouse#all_text_remains_visible_during_web_font_loads) and is only available in mobile tests.

legible.name: Legible Text
legible.description: The percent of pages with legible text. Legibility is measured by [Lighthouse](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/font-sizes). This metric is only available in mobile tests.

linkText.name: Descriptive Link Text
linkText.description: The percent of pages with descriptive link text. Descriptiveness is measured by [Lighthouse](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/link-text). This metric is only available in mobile tests.

ol.name: onLoad
ol.description: The number of seconds from the time the navigation started until the document and all of its dependent resources have finished loading. See the [load event on MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Events/load) for more info.

numUrls.name: Sample Size
numUrls.description: The number of URLs analyzed in this report.

pctHttps.name: HTTPS Requests
pctHttps.description: The percent of all requests in the crawl whose URLs are prefixed with `https`.

pctVuln.name: Pages with Vulnerable JS
pctVuln.description: The percent of crawled pages that contain at least one known third-party JavaScript vulnerability. Vulnerabilities are detected by [Lighthouse](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/vulnerabilities) using data from [Snyk](https://snyk.io/vuln?packageManager=all). This metric is only available in mobile tests.

tcp.name: TCP Connections Per Page
tcp.description: The number of TCP connections per page.

h2.name: HTTP/2 Requests
h2.description: The percent of all requests in the crawl using HTTP/2.

ttci.name: Time to Interactive
ttci.description: The number of seconds from the time the navigation started until the CPU had at least 5 seconds of quiescence. This metric comes from [Lighthouse](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/time-to-interactive) as is only available in mobile tests. [Read more](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1GGiI9-7KeY3TPqS3YT271upUVimo-XiL5mwWorDUD4c/edit#heading=h.iqlwzaf6lqrh).

ttfi.name: First CPU Idle
ttfi.description: The number of seconds from the time the navigation started until the page is minimally interactive. This metric comes from [Lighthouse](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/first-cpu-idle) as is only available in mobile tests. [Read more](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1GGiI9-7KeY3TPqS3YT271upUVimo-XiL5mwWorDUD4c/edit#heading=h.d06i5ycfxaow).

reqCss.name: CSS Requests
reqCss.description: The number of external stylesheets requested by the page. An external stylesheets is identified as a resource with the `css` file extension or a MIME type containing `css`.

offscreenImages.name: Offscreen Image Savings
offscreenImages.description: The number of kilobytes that could be saved per page by lazy-loading offscreen and hidden images. This metric comes from [Lighthouse](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/offscreen-images) and is only available in mobile tests.

optimizedImages.name: Optimized Image Savings
optimizedImages.description: The number of kilobytes that could be saved per page by setting JPEG compression levels to 85 or lower. This metric comes from [Lighthouse](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/optimize-images) and is only available in mobile tests.

reqFont.name: Font Requests
reqFont.description: The number of fonts requested by the page. A font is identified as a resource with the `eot`, `ttf`, `woff`, `woff2`, or `otf` file extensions or a MIME type containing `font`.

reqHtml.name: HTML Requests
reqHtml.description: The number of HTML documents requested by the page. An HTML document is identified as a resource with the `html` or `html` file extensions or a MIME type containing `html`.

reqImg.name: Image Requests
reqImg.description: The number of external images requested by the page. An external image is identified as a resource with the `png`, `gif`, `jpg`, `jpeg`, `webp`, `ico`, or `svg` file extensions or a MIME type containing `image`.

reqJs.name: JavaScript Requests
reqJs.description: The number of external scripts requested by the page. An external script is identified as a resource with the `js` or `json` file extensions or a MIME type containing `script` or `json`.

reqOther.name: Other Requests
reqOther.description: The number of all unidentified resources requested by the page. An unidentified resource is one that does not match a known script, font, image, stylesheet, XML file, video, HTML document, or plaintext file.

reqTotal.name: Total Requests
reqTotal.description: The number of resources requested by the page.

reqVideo.name: Video Requests
reqVideo.description: The number of videos requested by the page. A video is identified as a resource with the `mp4`, `swf`, `f4v`, or `flv` file extensions or a MIME type containing `flash`.

cruxFp.name: First Paint
cruxFp.description: The number of seconds from the time the navigation started until the browser first renders. See the [Paint Timing API](https://w3c.github.io/paint-timing/#first-paint) for more info.

cruxFcp.name: First Contentful Paint
cruxFcp.description: The number of seconds from the time the navigation started until the browser first renders. See the [Paint Timing API](https://w3c.github.io/paint-timing/#first-paint) for more info.

cruxDcl.name: DOMContentLoaded
cruxDcl.description: The number of seconds from the time the navigation started until the browser first renders any text or graphics.

cruxOl.name: Onload
cruxOl.description: The number of seconds from the time the navigation started until the document and all of its dependent resources have finished loading.

cruxFid.name: First Input Delay
cruxFid.description: The number of milliseconds from the time the user initiates an interaction to the time the page responds. See [FID in CrUX](https://developers.google.com/web/updates/2018/07/first-input-delay-in-crux).

cruxFastFcp.name: Fast First Contentful Paint
cruxFastFcp.description: The percent of "fast" FCP experiences less than 1 second.

cruxFastFp.name: Fast First Paint
cruxFastFp.description: The percent of "fast" FP experiences less than 1 second.

cruxFastDcl.name: Fast DOM Content Loaded
cruxFastDcl.description: The percent of "fast" DCL experiences less than 1 second.

cruxFastOl.name: Fast Onload
cruxFastOl.description: The percent of "fast" OL experiences less than 1 second.

cruxFastFid.name: Fast First Input Delay
cruxFastFid.description: The percent of "fast" FID experiences less than 50 ms. See [FID in CrUX](https://developers.google.com/web/updates/2018/07/first-input-delay-in-crux).

cruxSlowFcp.name: Slow First Contentful Paint
cruxSlowFcp.description: The percent of "slow" FCP experiences, which are 2.5 seconds or greater.

cruxSlowFid.name: Slow First Input Delay
cruxSlowFid.description: The percent of "slow" FID experiences, which are 250 ms or greater. See [FID in CrUX](https://developers.google.com/web/updates/2018/07/first-input-delay-in-crux).

vulnJs.name: Vulnerable JavaScript Libraries Per Page
vulnJs.description: The number of known third-party JavaScript vulnerabilities per page. Vulnerabilities are detected by [Lighthouse](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/vulnerabilities) using data from [Snyk](https://snyk.io/vuln?packageManager=all). This metric is only available in mobile tests.

pwaScores.name: PWA Scores
pwaScores.description: This metric tracks the median [PWA score](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/v3/scoring#pwa) in [Lighthouse](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/). Lighthouse is popular automated tool for improving the quality of web pages.

swControlledPages.name: Service Worker Controlled Pages
swControlledPages.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that have triggered the ```ServiceWorkerControlledPage``` [use counter](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/public/mojom/web_feature/web_feature.mojom) that fires whenever a page is controlled by a service worker.

a11yScores.name: Accessibility Scores
a11yScores.description: This metric tracks the distribution of Accessibility category scores in Lighthouse.

a11yButtonName.name: Button Name
a11yButtonName.description: The percent of pages that pass the [Lighthouse audit](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/button-name) that checks if buttons have an accessible name.

a11yBypass.name: Bypass
a11yBypass.description: The percent of pages that pass the [Lighthouse audit](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/bypass) that checks if pages provide a way to bypass repeated blocks of content.

a11yImageAlt.name: Image Alt
a11yImageAlt.description: The percent of pages that pass the [Lighthouse audit](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/image-alt) that checks if all images have alternate text.

a11yLabel.name: Label
a11yLabel.description: The percent of pages that pass the [Lighthouse audit](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/label) that checks if all form elements have associated labels.

a11yLinkName.name: Link Name
a11yLinkName.description: The percent of pages that pass the [Lighthouse audit](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/link-name) that checks if all links have discernable text.

asyncClipboardRead.name: (üê° Launched) Async Clipboard Read
asyncClipboardRead.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that *read* data from the system clipboard via the [Async Clipboard API](https://web.dev/image-support-for-async-clipboard/).

asyncClipboardWrite.name: (üê° Launched) Async Clipboard Write
asyncClipboardWrite.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that *write* data to the system clipboard via the [Async Clipboard API](https://web.dev/image-support-for-async-clipboard/).

badgeSet.name: (üê° Launched) Badge Set
badgeSet.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that *set* a badge via the [Badging API](https://web.dev/badging-api/).

badgeClear.name: (üê° Launched) Badge Clear
badgeClear.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that *clear* a badge via the [Badging API](https://web.dev/badging-api/).

contactPicker.name: (üê° Launched) Contact Picker
contactPicker.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that access contacts via the [Contact Picker API](https://web.dev/contact-picker/).

getInstalledRelatedApps.name: (üê° Launched) Get Installed Related Apps
getInstalledRelatedApps.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that get the installed related apps via the [Get Installed Related Apps API](https://web.dev/get-installed-related-apps/).

periodicBackgroundSync.name: (üê° Launched) Periodic Background Sync
periodicBackgroundSync.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that observe a `periodicsync` event that was registered via the [Periodic Background Sync API](https://web.dev/periodic-background-sync/).

periodicBackgroundSyncRegister.name: (üê° Launched) Periodic Background Sync Register
periodicBackgroundSyncRegister.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that register a `periodicsync` event via the [Periodic Background Sync API](https://web.dev/periodic-background-sync/).

shapeDetectionBarcode.name: (üê° Launched) Shape Detection (Barcode)
shapeDetectionBarcode.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that use the barcode detector via the [Shape Detection API](https://web.dev/shape-detection/).

shapeDetectionFace.name: (üö© Behind flag) Shape Detection (Face)
shapeDetectionFace.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that use the face detector via the [Shape Detection API](https://web.dev/shape-detection/).

shapeDetectionText.name: (üö© Behind flag) Shape Detection (Text)
shapeDetectionText.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that use the text detector via the [Shape Detection API](https://web.dev/shape-detection/).

webOTP.name: (üê° Launched) Web OTP
webOTP.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that receive a one-time password (OTP) via the [Web OTP API](https://web.dev/sms-receiver-api-announcement/).

webShareContainingFiles.name: (üê° Launched) Web Share (Containing Files)
webShareContainingFiles.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that share files via the [Web Share API](https://web.dev/web-share/).

webShareNoFiles.name: (üê° Launched) Web Share (No Files)
webShareNoFiles.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that share text via the [Web Share API](https://web.dev/web-share/).

notificationTriggers.name: (üö© Behind flag) Notification Triggers
notificationTriggers.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that use scheduled notifications via the [Notification Triggers API](https://web.dev/notification-triggers/).

webNFCRead.name: (üß™ Origin trial) Web NFC
webNFCRead.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that *read* NFC tags via the [Web NFC API](https://web.dev/nfc/).

webNFCWrite.name: (üß™ Origin trial) Web NFC
webNFCWrite.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that *write* NFC tags via the [Web NFC API](https://web.dev/nfc/).

screenWakeLock.name: (üê° Launched) Screen Wake Lock
screenWakeLock.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that acquire a screen wake lock via the [Screen Wake Lock API](https://web.dev/wakelock/).

state-of-images.name: State of Images
state-of-images.summary: Images are the most popular resource type on the web. In this report we analyze how images are being used across the web.

state-of-javascript.name: State of JavaScript
state-of-javascript.summary: JavaScript powers the modern web, enabling rich and interactive web applications. In this report we dive into how JavaScript is used on the web, and its adoption and trends both for mobile and desktop experiences.

loading-speed.name: Loading Speed
loading-speed.summary: Web performance can directly impact business metrics like conversion and user happiness. This report analyzes various performance metrics in the lifecycle of a loading page including those used by many modern progressive web apps.

state-of-the-web.name: State of the Web
state-of-the-web.summary: This report captures a long view of the web, including the adoption of techniques for efficient network utilization and usage of web standards like HTTPS.

search-engine-optimization.name: SEO
search-engine-optimization.summary: How websites are built can affect their ranking in search results. This report tracks the adoption of several key Search Engine Optimization (SEO) techniques.

page-weight.name: Page Weight
page-weight.summary: This report tracks the size and quantity of many popular web page resources. Sizes represent the number of bytes sent over the network, which may be compressed.

chrome-ux-report.name: Chrome User Experience Report
chrome-ux-report.summary: Loading and interactivity performance as experienced by real-world Chrome users across a diverse set of hardware and network conditions, powered by the [Chrome User Experience Report](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/chrome-user-experience-report/).

progressive-web-apps.name: Progressive Web Apps
progressive-web-apps.summary: This report examines the state of [Progressive Web Apps](https://developers.google.com/web/progressive-web-apps/) (PWAs). PWAs are a new class of web applications, enabled by the [Service Worker APIs](https://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Web/API/Service_Worker_API). Service workers allow apps to support network-independent loading, to receive push notifications as well as to synchronize data in the background, and‚Ää‚Äî‚Äätogether with [Web App Manifests](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Manifest)‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääallow users to install PWAs.

accessibility.name: Accessibility
accessibility.summary: This report tracks accessibility of pages as measured by [Lighthouse](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/). Metrics in this report are only available for mobile.

project-fugu.name: Capabilities
project-fugu.summary: The [Capabilities Project](https://web.dev/fugu-status/) (aka. Project Fugu üê°) is a cross-company effort at Google to make it possible for web apps to do anything native apps can, by exposing the capabilities of native platforms to the web platform, while maintaining user security, privacy, trust, and other core tenets of the web.
